page.title: 03F A R M I N G
page.content: Farming is a financial business today and governed by EEC regulations. There are more farm buildings for rearing and wintering sheep, cattle and pigs. The land is intensively farmed, scrubland being reclaimed and used for production of cash crops. Headage of dairy cows will now stay constant since the introduction of the milk quotas. Sheep numbers are going up as there is an annual ewe headage premium paid and a Government subsidy on the sale price. Beef cattle are reared intensively, feeding on silage, hay and concentrates. Farm machinery is more efficient and larger to work the fields, where many hedges have been removed.Orchards have almost disappeared from here,grants were paid for grubbing and clearing them. More productive crops,eg. cereal or potato, are grown.
